marketNews.title: BPS recorded that Indonesia's economic growth in 3Q25 slowed to +5.04% YoY
marketNews.content: BPS noted that Indonesia's economic growth in 3Q25 slowed to +5.04% YoY (vs. 2Q25: +5.12% YoY), relatively in line with consensus expectations at +5% YoY. Quarterly, the Indonesian economy grew +1.43% QoQ in 3Q25 (vs. 3Q24: +1.5% QoQ). This result brings Indonesia's economic growth over 9M25 to reach +5.01% YoY. From the expenditure side, Indonesia's economic growth in 3Q25 was suppressed by weakening household consumption - the largest contributor - which only recorded growth of +4.89% YoY (vs. 2Q25: +4.97% YoY), marking the weakest growth since 4Q23. This result was influenced by fewer public holidays and national demonstrations that took place at the end of August 2025. Meanwhile, economic growth in 3Q25 was supported by an increase in net exports - amidst slowing imports - and growth in government consumption. Indonesian exports in 3Q25 grew solidly by +9.91% YoY even though the US began imposing reciprocal tariffs in August 2025. Meanwhile, government consumption grew +5.49% YoY after contracting -0.33% YoY in the previous quarter, following the end of budget efficiency and the release of a stimulus package worth ~24.4 trillion rupiah for the June-July 2025 period. To further boost economic growth in 4Q25, the government announced 2 different stimulus packages in September and October 2025, valued at ~16.2 trillion rupiah and ~30 trillion rupiah, respectively. Slower economic growth in 3Q25 was also contributed by decelerating Gross Fixed Asset Formation (GFCF) to +5.04% YoY (vs. 2Q25: +6.99%) due to geopolitical and global trade tensions. Based on the business field, mining (-1.98% YoY) was the only industry experiencing contraction, driven by weakening coal demand in the global market and declining copper production in the Papua region. Meanwhile, the education services industry (+10.59% YoY), other services (+9.92% YoY), and corporate services (+9.94% YoY) recorded the highest growth following the start of the new academic year, an increase in the number of foreign tourists, and increased revenue from equipment rental services and professional services. Spatially, Sulawesi (+5.84% YoY) and Java (+5.17% YoY) recorded the highest economic growth in 3Q25, while Sumatra (+4.9% YoY), Kalimantan (+4.7% YoY), Bali and Nusra (+4.71% YoY), and Maluku and Papua (+2.68% YoY) recorded lower growth compared to national economic growth.

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway
marketNews.content: Finance Minister, Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa, projected that economic growth in 4Q25 could reach +5.67% YoY, resulting in 2025 economic growth reaching +5.2% YoY, driven by stimuli during the Christmas and New Year holiday period. Signs of economic improvement are already apparent, namely an increase in money supply growth (M2), credit growth, and the recent trend of expansion in Indonesia's manufacturing Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI).

tickerNews.title: BRMS Plans to Draw US$600 Million Loan for Expansion
tickerNews.content: BUMI RESOURCES MINERALS ($BRMS): President Director of Bumi Resources Minerals, Agoes Projosasmito, said on Wednesday (5/11) that the company plans to draw a syndicated loan facility of 600 million US dollars from foreign and local banks for various expansion plans. Agoes explained that of the total planned loan, approximately 300 million US dollars will be used for working on the underground gold mine project in Palu, Central Sulawesi. Meanwhile, the remainder of the planned loan funds will be allocated for exploration activities and plant construction at PT Gorontalo Minerals and plant construction at PT Linge Mineral Resources which manages gold and silver mines.

tickerNews.title: ITMG to Distribute Interim Dividend for 2025 Fiscal Year
tickerNews.content: ITMG: Indo Tambangraya Megah will distribute an interim dividend for the 2025 fiscal year amounting to ~$50 million or 738 rupiah per share, indicating a dividend yield of ~3.1% as of Wednesday (5/11). The cum date in the regular and negotiation markets is November 12, 2025, while payment will be on November 26, 2025.

tickerNews.title: TPIA Acquisition of Esso Retail Fuel Stations in Singapore expected to add ~$500 Million Revenue
tickerNews.content: TPIA: Chandra Asri Pacific said in its 3Q25 earnings call on Wednesday (5/11) that the acquisition of the Esso brand retail fuel station network in Singapore from ExxonMobil will provide additional revenue of ~$500 million, and directly contribute positively to net profit and operating cash flow (directly cash accretive). This acquisition plan is also expected to add stable recurring revenue from the high-margin Singapore retail gas station market, thus helping to balance TPIA's cyclical petrochemical business portfolio. The Esso gas station network in Singapore covers approximately 60 locations, consisting of 27 fully owned sites and 33 leased sites. Esso is currently the market leader for gas stations in Singapore based on the number of locations and fuel sales volume, with total sales reaching about 2.4 million barrels of fuel per year.

tickerNews.title: SSSG for MAPI, MAPA, and MAPB in 3Q25
tickerNews.content: MAPI: Mitra Adiperkasa recorded a same store sales growth (SSSG) of -0.1% YoY in 3Q25 (vs. 2Q25: -3.5% YoY), resulting in MAPI's SSSG over 9M25 contracting by -1.2% YoY (vs. 1H25: -1.7% YoY). Meanwhile, Map Aktif Adiperkasa ($MAPA) recorded SSSG of +1.2% YoY in 3Q25 (vs. 2Q25: -4.9% YoY), resulting in MAPA's SSSG over 9M25 contracting by -0.4% YoY (vs. 1H25: -1.3% YoY). Map Boga Adiperkasa ($MAPB) recorded SSSG of +1.8% YoY in 3Q25 (vs. 2Q25: -6.8% YoY), resulting in MAPB's SSSG over 9M25 contracting by -4.9% YoY (vs. 1H25: -8.1% YoY). The results in 3Q25 mark a continuation of MAPB's SSSG recovery trend, while also marking MAPB's first SSSG growth since 3Q23.

tickerNews.title: CBRE Signs Credit Facility with BBRI for Pipe-Laying Vessel Acquisition
tickerNews.content: CBRE: Cakra Buana Resources Energi signed a credit facility agreement of up to 49 million US dollars or ~803.4 billion rupiah with Bank Rakyat Indonesia ($BBRI). This facility with a tenor of 90 months will be used by CBRE to partially finance the acquisition of 1 unit of a pipe-laying and lifting vessel type ship.

tickerNews.title: PTBA Management Expects Stable Coal Prices in 2026 and Discusses DMO Obligation with PLN
tickerNews.content: PTBA: Bukit Asam management in the 3Q25 earnings call on Tuesday (4/11) predicted that coal prices tend to stabilize in 2026, so production volume, stripping ratio, and coal sales next year will also be maintained at levels similar to 2025. Regarding the domestic market obligation (DMO) liability, PTBA management stated they have discussed with PLN to only supply 25% of the company's total coal production - in accordance with applicable regulations - potentially increasing the contribution of export sales and the average selling price of PTBA going forward. PTBA management also stated that the coal transportation contract with KAI was changed from a 'wet contract' type (service provider bears all operational components including fuel) to a 'dry contract' type (service provider only acts as an operator) as of the end of October 2025, potentially suppressing fuel costs because PTBA can obtain fuel at a more competitive price compared to through KAI.

tickerNews.title: KIJA Records Marketing Sales of Rp 2.92 Trillion as of September 2025, Reaching 83% of 2025 Target
tickerNews.content: KIJA: Corporate Secretary of Kawasan Industri Jababeka, Muljadi Suganda, told Kontan that the company recorded marketing sales of 2.92 trillion rupiah during 9M25 (+22% YoY), equivalent to ~83% of the 2025 target of 3.5 trillion rupiah. Muljadi explained that the largest marketing sales were contributed by the Kendal industrial estate amounting to 2.02 trillion rupiah, which came from industrial land sales to companies in the tire sector, building materials, and furniture. Meanwhile, marketing sales from Cikarang reached 896 billion rupiah, originating from a combination of industrial land and building pre-sales, residential and commercial property, particularly from the data center and personal care sectors.

tickerNews.title: MSCI Index Review Announcement and Himbara USD Deposit Rate Hike
tickerNews.content: MSCI will announce the index review on Thursday (6/11) around 05.00 WIB. Stocks associated with MSCI may experience volatility after the results of the review announcement. The state-owned bank association (Himbara) - consisting of Bank Rakyat Indonesia ($BBRI), Bank Mandiri ($BMRI), Bank Negara Indonesia ($BBNI), and Bank Tabungan Negara ($BBTN) - officially raised the counter rate deposit interest rate denominated in US dollars to 4% per year on Wednesday (5/11), based on the respective official websites of the banks. This increase is valid for all balance categories and all tenors up to 12 months. This change was previously announced at the end of September 2025.

tickerNews.title: BMRI and BBRI Have Fully Absorbed Government Fund Placements, Government Opens Opportunity for Further Liquidity Support for Himbara
tickerNews.content: Director General at the Ministry of Finance, Febrio Nathan Kacaribu, stated on Wednesday (5/11) that Bank Mandiri ($BMRI) and Bank Rakyat Indonesia ($BBRI) have fully channeled the government fund placements of 55 trillion rupiah each, which were received in September 2025. Febrio also mentioned that the government opens the opportunity to re-strengthen liquidity in the state-owned bank association (Himbara), although without further detailed explanation.

tickerNews.title: BELI Clarifies Layoffs Affecting 270 Employees Due to Organizational Adjustment for Operational Efficiency
tickerNews.content: Global Digital Niaga ($BELI) stated in a clarification to the IDX that the company has made organizational adjustments resulting in layoffs (PHK) for 270 employees, as an effort to streamline operational costs. BELI's clarification emerged after mass media reported that the company carried out layoffs. BELI explained that the organizational adjustment was completed in October 2025, and the company has provided compensation packages that are in accordance with or even exceed those stipulated in Indonesian labor regulations. The company also confirmed that the organizational adjustment does not have a material impact on the company's daily operational activities.

tickerNews.title: HUMI Acquires One LPG Carrier Vessel for US$5.9 Million, Reaching 8 out of 10 Target Vessels for 2025
tickerNews.content: Humpuss Maritim Internasional ($HUMI) through its business entity, PT Hutama Trans Kencana, has acquired 1 unit of an LPG carrier vessel worth 5.9 million US dollars from a non-affiliated party. With this acquisition, HUMI has added 8 vessels from the target addition of 10 vessels throughout 2025. The total capex spent to finance the purchase of these 8 vessels reached ~53.1 million US dollars, equivalent to 134% of the 2025 capex allocation.

tickerNews.title: AXIO to Distribute Interim Dividend for 2025 Fiscal Year
tickerNews.content: Tera Data Indonusa ($AXIO) will distribute an interim dividend for the 2025 fiscal year amounting to ~29.2 billion rupiah or 5 rupiah per share, indicating a dividend yield of ~3.9% as of Wednesday (5/11). The cum date in the regular and negotiation markets is November 13, 2025, while payment will be on December 5, 2025.

tickerNews.title: ASSA to Distribute Interim Dividend for 2025 Fiscal Year
tickerNews.content: Adi Sarana Armada ($ASSA) will distribute an interim dividend for the 2025 fiscal year amounting to ~73.8 billion rupiah or 20 rupiah per share, indicating a dividend yield of ~1.8% as of Wednesday (5/11). The cum date in the regular and negotiation markets is November 13, 2025, while payment will be on November 21, 2025.
